syllabus:
**Objectives**: This course is designed to support students in their use of Science English language and to **improve their proficiency** through intensive and extensive skill/strategy training. This class also aims to **build up students’ proficiency** **in** all four language skills—**reading, listening, speaking and writing** —through a series of activities and tasks. In order to do so, there a **three-pronged approach** to the course:

**1)** Firstly, there will be **no course textbook!** 9 groups of three or four students will be responsible for **choosing an article, video and/or other material** for each class under the general theme of science, and inform the teacher more than a week before the class. Then on the day itself the group will give a **short PPT summarizing the main points** of their chosen material. They will also have made a **comprehension and discussion worksheet** on the material to be followed by **an activity or a game**.

**2)** Secondly, over the first-half of the semester, students will undertake a **task-based project**, in which the task groups are asked to **prepare an experiment** in an area or topic that is of interest to them, **present their experiment** to the class at mid-term, and then **write up a report** on their experiments.

**3)** Thirdly, over the course of the second half of the semester, students will undertake a **writing workshop**, in which students are asked to **investigate and write a five-paragraph about scientific areas and topics** that have been taught throughout the course or that are of interest to them.

**4)** Furthermore, students should **compile a portfolio in their notebooks** outlining the major English-language experiences they have had during the semester. **Proof of any autonomous work** is mandatory and will be graded.

**All elements** of the course **will be evaluated and assessed** when calculating the final grade.

**Course** **Materials:**

There is **no textbook!** A **notebook is necessary** for taking notes on new vocabulary, phrases, grammar, task project, and homework assignments.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Ten Commandments!**

1.  Punctual attendance is essential for this class. **Talk to or email me** if you can’t attend class.
2.  The material for this class is mostly prepared by the students. These **articles/materials must be handed in a week early** for the class to work properly.
3.  **Actively participate** in class discussions.
4.  **Grades will be downgraded** for failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do homework. 
5.  You need to **submit** homework **_several times_** during the semester.
6.  **Task** assignments and homework **must** be done and be **on time**.
7.  **Smartphones**, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
8.  **No eating** during class.
9.  **Drinks are allowed**.
10.   Students **should** **practice their English** every chance they get. Any English-language encounters should be recorded for **grading as autonomous learning**.

**Grading Policy****:** **The Business!**

Final Grades are based and assessed on student performances as follows:

1.  Attendance and Participation: 10%
2.  Student Lesson: 20% (Presentation 10%, materials: 10%)
3.  Quizzes (x2): 20%
4.  Experiment Task: 20% (Presentation: 10%, drafts and report: 10%)
5.  Essay: 15%
6.  Autonomous learning: 15%
